intro: Eriocaulon latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf spikerush, is a member of the Cyperaceae family. It is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its dense, spike-like inflorescences and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and swampy areas, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, arranged in clusters along the central stem. Eriocaulon latifolium plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
